title: 19 attorneys general call on feds to recall some Kia and Hyundai models
description: 19 Attorney Generals sent a letter to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration asking for the initiation of a recall of Kia and Hyundai models.

title: School bus driver faces 30 child abuse charges after seen braking hard in video
description: A Colorado school bus driver faces 30 counts of child abuse after he braked hard in an apparent attempt to teach students on the bus a lesson.

title: Biden could announce 2024 reelection run as soon as next week, aides say
description: President Joe Biden’s team has told allies they are ready to announce a run for reelection as soon as next week.

title: Dead bodies line the streets of Sudan's capital as fighting enters 6th day
description: Dead bodies lined the streets of the Sudan capital of Khartoum, as intense fighting between the Sudanese military and Rapid Support Forces continued for a sixth day.

title: Florida hit with gas shortage after severe weather, panic buying
description: AAA estimates that it will take about a week for the issue to clear up.

title: Guns found at airport checkpoints increased in 1st months of 2023, TSA says
description: TSA reported a more than 10% increase in recovered firearms for the first quarter of 2023 compared to the same time last year.

title: South Korea exporting arms to Poland amid controversy over lethal aid to Ukraine
description: South Korea has confirmed the exports deal to Poland will continue after President Yoon Suk Yeol signaled his intentions to possibly send weapons directly to Ukraine.

title: Why stock prices are rising and what experts say comes next
description: Stocks have rebounded even as recession worries loom.

title: Florida removes company after it sends 4 a.m. emergency alert test
description: Florida's emergency management agency fired the company responsible for sending out a 4 a.m. alert to residents' phones. It was intended for TV.

title: Charges dropped against Alec Baldwin in fatal on-set 'Rust' shooting: Sources
description: Charges against Alec Baldwin have been dropped in the fatal on-set "Rust" shooting.

title: Oakland A's purchase land for new stadium in Las Vegas
description: The Oakland Athletics have signed a binding agreement to purchase land for a new retractable roof ballpark in Las Vegas after being unable to build a new venue in the Bay Area

title: Durbin invites Chief Justice Roberts to testify about Supreme Court ethics
description: Justice Clarence Thomas has been mired in controversy over ties to a GOP donor.

title: One-third of US households used free at-home COVID test website, report finds
description: A new CDC report published Thursday found about one-third of households in the United States used the free at-home COVID test website set up by the Biden administration.

title: BuzzFeed to close news division, cut 15% of all staff
description: Pulitzer Prize winning digital media company BuzzFeed will shut down its news division as it cuts about 15% of its entire staff

title: At least 78 dead in stampede during $9 aid event
description: The tragedy occurred on one of the last days of Ramadan, as people were reportedly gathering for a charity event organized by local merchants.

title: Some jail staffers resign after death of inmate allegedly 'eaten alive' by bedbugs
description: An investigation into the death of a man whose family claims he was "eaten alive by insects and bedbugs" in an Atlanta jail has led to changes.

title: House passes trans athlete ban for girls and women's teams
description: The Republican-led House has passed a bill that would bar federally supported schools and colleges from allowing transgender athletes whose biological sex assigned at birth was male from competing on girls or women’s sports teams

title: Why the onslaught of atmospheric rivers won't help water levels in the Colorado River
description: The issues surrounding depleting water levels along the Colorado River basin have become as heated as the arid climate contributing to the moisture-sapping megadrought.

title: Woman sentenced to 21 years for trying to kill lookalike with poisoned cheesecake
description: On a late summer day in 2016, Viktoria Nasyrova traveled from Brooklyn to Queens so she could visit the Forest Hills home of Olga Tsvyk. She brought a special dessert.

title: Michelin recalls tires that don't have enough snow traction
description: Michelin is recalling more than 542,000 light truck tires in the U.S. because they don’t have enough traction to work in all snowy conditions

title: US traffic deaths drop slightly in 2022 but still a 'crisis'
description: The number of people killed on U.S. roadways decreased slightly last year, but government officials said the 42,795 people who died is still a national crisis

title: Todd Haimes, who led a theater company to Broadway, dies
description: Todd Haimes, who led the Roundabout Theatre Company from an off-off-Broadway company teetering on the edge of bankruptcy into a major theatrical force with works on five stages — including three Broadway theaters — and dozens of Tony Awards, has died

title: WATCH:  SpaceX Starship rocket launches into space
description: The first launch attempt was scrubbed Monday due to a frozen valve.

title: SpaceX live updates: Starship rocket launches into space
description: SpaceX will attempt a second launch of its Starship rocket after the first launch attempt was scrubbed due to a frozen valve in the pressurization system.

title: US unemployment claims tick up to 245,000, but still low
description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits rose last week but remains low by historic standards

title: Relief options if you’re in debt from your kid’s education
description: Federal parent PLUS loans have become a last resort for many lower-income families paying for a kid’s college education

title: WATCH:  Rare hybrid solar eclipse seen in Australia
description: A rare hybrid solar eclipse was seen on Thursday over the Australian town of Exmouth in Australia, one of the few places in the world to witness the cosmic event.

title: Singapore to resume executions after 6-month break
description: A Singaporean man is scheduled to be hanged next week for abetting an attempt to smuggle cannabis into the island-state

title: 6-year-old, parents and neighbor shot after basketball rolls into yard
description: A North Carolina man allegedly shot a 6-year-old girl, her parents and an additional neighbor after a basketball rolled into his yard.

title: SpaceX planning 2nd launch attempt of its Starship rocket Thursday
description: SpaceX is planning the second launch attempt of the world's largest rocket -- Starship -- after the first attempt was scrubbed Monday.

title: Trump may not appear at upcoming trial in NYC due to 'logistical burdens': Attorney
description: If Donald Trump doesn't attend his defamation and battery trial in New York City next week, his attorney says it will be to spare the city the burden of keeping him safe.

title: Fox News 'ready to defend' against suit brought by 2nd voting machine company
description: A day after Fox News agreed to pay $787.5 million to Dominion, Fox officials said the network will be "ready to defend" itself against a similar suit from Smartmatic.

title: DeSantis woos conservative members of Congress as Trump racks up endorsements
description: Trump and DeSantis are ramping up efforts to shore up support from members of Congress.

title: IRS whistleblower has told Congress that Hunter Biden probe is being mishandled
description: An IRS supervisor has told lawmakers he has information that suggests the Biden administration could be mishandling the investigation into Hunter Biden, sources say.

title: Stampede in Yemen’s capital kills at least 78, official says
description: Yemen's Houthi rebels say people have stampeded at an event to distribute financial aid in Yemen’s capital and at least 78 people are dead and dozens more are injured

title: Semi-automatic rifle ban passes Washington state Legislature
description: A ban on dozens of semi-automatic rifles has cleared the Democratic-controlled Washington state Legislature
